Piece - a description of a single piece in the checkers game

Craig A. Damon

Method Detail

getPosition

public int getPosition()
get the position of a piece, in 1-32 notation. 1-4 are the 4 back-row spaces for Red, with 1 being on the right and 4 being the left back corner.

Returns:
the position in 1-32 notation or -1 if the piece is no longer on the board

setPosition

public void setPosition(int pos)
set the position of a piece after it has moved

Parameters:
pos - the new position in 1-32 notation

destroy

public void destroy()
destroy a piece, removing it from the board

kingMe

public void kingMe()
king a piece

isKing

public boolean isKing()
is this piece a king, capable of moving both forward and backwards

Returns:
true if the piece is a king

get the color of the piece

Returns:
the color

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
get a description of this piece

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
one of the strings "R ", "W ", "RK", "WK"

possibleAdvances

public java.util.Collection<Advance> possibleAdvances(CheckerBoard board)
list all the possible advances (simple moves) that are legal for this piece, given the state of the board

Parameters:
board -
Returns:
the advances in no particular order, never null but may be empty

possibleCaptures

public java.util.Collection<Capture> possibleCaptures(CheckerBoard board)
list all the possible jumps (captures) that are legal for this piece, given the state of the board. Where appropriate the captures include multiple jumps as a single Capture move

Parameters:
board -
Returns:
the captures in no particular order, never null but may be empty
